message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public void deleteProduct(int productId) throws ProductNotFoundException {
    Iterator<Product> it = allProducts.iterator();
    while(it.hasNext()){
        Product p = it.next();
        if (p.getId().equals(productId)){
            it.remove();
            System.out.println("Successfully removed the product " + productId);
            return;
        }
    }
    throw new ProductNotFoundException ("No Such Product");
}
<<<explanation>>>: You don't need to use the index to remove an item from the list when using an Iterator. The Iterator has a remove method that removes the last element returned by the iterator. This is the correct way to remove an item from a list while iterating over it.
